comments.text:
+Asn Ddoing Ok. I was just pointing out how harmful racial fetishization 
can be. If you prefer Song Joong Ki over Channing Tatum, then it's all 
right. I'm not here to talk over a group of people wanting someone from 
their own group
~I didn't realize the commenter was Korean themself~ but others outside of 
the groups usually inflict harm towards that one group because they make 
stereotypes without really knowing an actual person from that group. It's 
like crushing on a character from another country's media and expecting 
every single person in that country to be like the character. I personally 
don't mind if these girls say "I want to date a K-pop idol" or "I want 
someone like a K-pop idol" but it crosses a line if they do say "I want to 
date a Korean" because they are implying that they think K-pop idols=Every 
Korean person. That's racial fetishization. That's what bugs me. People 
from my race are fetishized and it disgusts me because people outside of my 
race think we're all the same. I developed low-self esteem due to 
assumptions like that and I would hate to see it done to others. A simple 
crush can turn into an obsession and there has been studies on that. Just 
do a simple google search of "racial fetishization" and it will show you. 
I don't want to get in-depth about a western/America/European idols because 
they are usually the media's pinnacle of beauty. Global society expects 
people to crush over western, typically White, celebrities because of White 
supremacy embedded in this global society. Even if you "fetishize" these 
Western idols,
you are not doing harm to them or to their people.You are elevating their 
position to a higher level in racial hierarchy. And believe or not, 
White supremacy has created racial fetishization because the stereotypes 
that non-White groups have are usually accepted by the White supremacist 
society anyways. It does a lot of harm and I've seen it with my own eyes.
comments.author: Ren Zaragoza

translation for sajaegi means "manipulation", which is used when a 
label/group/artist "manipulates" the charts by bulk-buying one certain 
album (and selling it and then buying it back so it counts as 2 sales per 
album on Hanteo) or streaming a song thousands of times per day. It's like 
the methods some fans use for their idols (mainly for male groups) when a 
bunch of fans stream their songs on a certain hour to get the #1 on real 
time or when they buy a certain album in a certain day to reach a high spot 
on the daily charts, but doing it on a greater scale, as some music 
companies have way bigger resources than the fans. So jealous fans were 
blaming SISTAR's label (which is not one of the big ones) to "do sajaegi" 
with this song, because it won like 10-12 awards on music shows, basically 
because it has been the biggest song of this year, and I doubt there'll be

En Agosto del 2013 las tres grandes compañías de Corea (SM, YG, JYP) y 
alguna que otra random presentaron una demanda en la Fiscalía de Seoul 
denunciando un fraude en las ventas digitales de singles del el país. Esta 
"manipulación" consistía en perfiles falsos que reproducían las canciones 
en stream para elevar sus posiciones en los rankings, lo que permitía al 
grupo manipulado ganar popularidad.

nombre que más destacó fue el de la girlband SISTAR.﻿

top_comment.text:
Okay, even if it's for one person or for many, here are the translations x
So B is for what Baro (the guy) sends to the girl.
D is for what Dasom (the girl) sends to the guy, alright? :)
If that is confusing, don't worry- just follow the order.

So, to start off, it's pretty clear that B gets spam :P
Then, he starts the conversation.

B: What are you doing today? Do you wanna watch a movie or something?
D: Today? I have something on today, why?
B: Oh ㅠㅠ...never mind then...
D: Okay, I'll try to change the time of the appointment!
B: Okie okie~ First time in a long time that we're having a date ^-^
D: Date?? We're just meeting up~ Over reaction hehehe
B: Oh- of course! It's not a date, is it...hahaha...I have to go somewhere 
(suddenly) today, I don't think I can go. Sorry ㅠ,.ㅠ
D: Really? I got it!!! Guess we can't do anything about it then ㅠㅠ

(After having his little sad moment, Baro quickly presses the bus stop 
button to get off. Meanwhile, after a rage attack on the poor 
bear [haha] Dasom thinks: "Wait, I can just go to him!")

D: Frustrating oppa (what you call a guy who is a little older than you/a 
lover in Korean)! -_-^ Where are you?! Are you busy?
B: Yeah. I'm a little busy now, so I'll call you later~

And...yeah!

I tried to be as accurate and detailed as possible...
Hope you guys who didn't understand the texting can enjoy the MV even more 
now! xx

-Julia x﻿

+Michello Marshmellow If you happen to have knowledge about Physical Sales, 
well you can understand this well.

( NOTE: This is just what i have learned. Please correct me if I'm wrong )

SAJAEGI (Hangul ;; 사재기) Means 'HOARDING' in English. It is actually the 
duplication of Barcodes. The company is the one who is responsible of this. 
E.G, when the company decides to do this, The album has a barcode and then 
they scan it, with the same album (Not replaced) and Scanning it and 
Getting another Barcode and  putting it again.

Another Scandal is from B1A4. You know they had their 2nd Win on 'LONELY' 
at MuCore? Well, WM Entertainment (WM 엔터테인멘트) is the one responsible for 
that. 

Well, i haven't heard any Rumors about this, But they won Against SNSD '
MR.MR' and I can clearly see it's IMPOSSIBLY DIFFICULT about that. IU was

comments.text:
1. Guy: What are you doing today? Wanna watch a movie?
(오늘 뭐해? 영화나 볼까?)
2. Girl:  Today? I have an appointment, though... why?
(오늘? 약속있는데 왜?)
3. Guy: Oh... I can't do anything about it...
(아... 어쩔수없지 뭐...)
4. Girl: Then I'll try to decide what time.
(그럼 약속시간 조 정해볼께!)
5. Guy: Ok! Ok! It's been long time since we last dated!
(오키 오키! 간만에 테이트네 ^_^)
6. Girl: Date??? But we're just meeting, that's too much. Hahaha 
(데이트?? 그냥 만난거지. 오버하긴 ㅎㅎㅎ)
7. Guy: Is it? It's not a date... hahahaha
(그...그렇지? 데이트는 아니지!)
Guy: Something suddenly came up. It seems that I can't go. Sorry. ㅠ_ㅠ
(갑자기 일이 생겨서 못갈것 같아. 미안. ㅠ__ㅠ)
8. Girl: Really? Okay, oh well.
(그래? 알겠어 어쩔수없지 ㅠ__ㅠ)
Girl: (Thought bubble): Ah! I should just meet him!
(어! 내가 가면 되잖아!!)
9. Girl: Oppa! You're so irritating! Where are you? T_T
(답답한 오빠! 어디야?!) 
Girl: Busy? 
(바빠?)
10. Boy: Yeah. I'm a bit busy right now. I'll text you later~
(응. 지금 좀 바빠서 다시 연락할께~)

Wah, they actually used Korean slang in the title lol -- "Some" 썸 can be 
used as a short form of 썸남 or 쩜녀 meaning literally "some guy" or "some 
girl" that you're very intimate with but have not officially declared your 
love for one another nor begun dating yet, thus not making both of you a 
couple -- yet.  I guess Baro and Dasom were  썸남 and 쩜녀 here until the end
